metadata.Title: CVE-2013-5653 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The getenv and filenameforall functions in Ghostscript 9.10 ignore the "-dSAFER" argument, which allows remote attackers to read data via a crafted postscript file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-5653` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ghostscript - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.2
ghostscript-x - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.2
libgs9 - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.2
libgs9-common - 9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ghostscript package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.18~dfsg~0-0ubuntu2.2').
